summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Expedia Group, dated January 24, 2020. It commands Expedia to produce records related to flights purchased, booked, or taken by Ghislaine Maxwell by February 7, 2020, as part of a criminal investigation into violations of 18 U.S.C. ยง 2423(a). The document includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena to Expedia Group as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The individual for whom the subpoena requests all flight records from Expedia, indicating she is a subject of the grand jury investigation.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is leading the grand jury investigation into Maxwell, as evidenced by the subpoena for her flight records.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena to Expedia
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issued a grand jury subpoena to Expedia Group, commanding the production of flight records for Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Compliance Deadline for Subpoena
events.description: The deadline for Expedia to produce the requested flight records to the FBI or appear before the grand jury.

locations: U.S. Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: A federal grand jury in the Southern District of New York was actively investigating Ghislaine Maxwell as of January 2020 for suspected violations of 18 U.S.C. ยง 2423(a), which relates to transportation of minors for illegal sexual activity.
The subpoena specifically targeted Expedia Group for all records of flights purchased, booked, or taken by Ghislaine Maxwell, indicating investigators were tracing her travel patterns.
The U.S. Attorney's Office requested Expedia not disclose the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.
The document shows the investigation was ongoing and active in early 2020, prior to Maxwell's arrest in July 2020.
